report_source_files: U.S. News & World Report 2026 Best Colleges Rankings
UH Mānoa Office of Admissions Data

strategic_profile.executive_summary: As the flagship of the University of Hawaiʻi system, UH Mānoa is a premier R1 research institution known for its global leadership in oceanography, astronomy, and tropical sciences. It provides an affordable, multicultural education that integrates traditional Hawaiian learning with cutting-edge environmental research.

analyst_takeaways.insight: The overall acceptance rate has climbed to approximately 86.6% for the 2025 cycle, signaling a shift toward higher accessibility compared to previous years.
analyst_takeaways.implication: Prospective students have a high probability of admission if they meet basic academic thresholds, particularly for out-of-state applicants.

analyst_takeaways.insight: Hawaiʻi residents are offered guaranteed admission with a 3.2 cumulative GPA and completion of standard course requirements.
analyst_takeaways.implication: Local students can treat the university as a reliable 'safety' school while benefiting from significantly lower tuition rates.

analyst_takeaways.insight: UH Mānoa is a land-, sea-, space-, and sun-grant institution, a rare quadruple distinction.
analyst_takeaways.implication: Students in STEM, particularly Earth and Marine sciences, have access to research resources that rival Ivy League institutions.

campus_dynamics.social_environment: One of the most ethnically diverse campuses in the U.S., social life is shaped by a multicultural 'commuter-plus' vibe, with strong emphasis on local culture, surfing, and Division I athletics (Rainbow Warriors).
campus_dynamics.transportation_impact: Severe parking shortages make it a high-reliance commuter campus for the 25,000 daily visitors; students heavily utilize the integrated 'TheBus' pass and on-campus 'Rainbow Shuttle' to navigate the dense urban setting.
campus_dynamics.research_impact: With over $570 million in annual extramural funding, research is the campus's primary economic and academic driver, offering undergraduates rare opportunities for mentored fieldwork in unique Pacific ecosystems.

current.test_policy_details: Test Optional; scores are only used if they benefit the applicant ('Do No Harm' policy).

trends.notes: Acceptance rate saw a significant increase to 86.6% according to preliminary 2024 cycle reports. Historical CDS indicates no waitlist policy.
Common Data Set Section C2 indicates the university does not maintain a freshman waitlist.

gpa.notes: Admissions are holistic, but a cumulative GPA of 3.2+ generally guarantees admission for Hawaii residents. Roughly 49% of admitted students have a GPA of 3.75 or higher.

testing.policy_note: Test-optional for most programs; however, scores are recommended for certain competitive majors and scholarship consideration.

colleges.name: Shidler College of Business
colleges.strategic_fit_advice: Requires high GPA and test scores for the Freshman Direct Admit Program (DAP); emphasizes leadership and professional networking.
colleges.housing_profile: Hale Aloha Lokelani features a dedicated Residential Learning Program (RLP) for business students.

colleges.name: College of Engineering
colleges.strategic_fit_advice: Requires a secondary review of math and science readiness; B or better in Calculus and Physics is preferred.
colleges.housing_profile: Engineering-specific Residential Learning Program provides peer mentoring and maker-space access.
colleges.student_archetype: Hands-on problem solvers and STEM enthusiasts

colleges.name: Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing
colleges.strategic_fit_advice: Extreme selectivity for High School Direct Entry (DEN); prioritizes healthcare experience and top-tier academic performance.
colleges.housing_profile: Often housed in freshman residence halls with cohort-based study groups.

majors.name: Nursing
majors.special_requirements: Requires TEAS exam with minimum 78% overall score; two-step application process (NCAS).

colleges.name: College of Natural Sciences
colleges.strategic_fit_advice: Ideal for students seeking research opportunities in unique Pacific ecosystems.
colleges.housing_profile: Hale Aloha Mokihana hosts the Natural Sciences Residential Learning Program.

majors.name: Computer Science
weeder_courses: ICS 211 Intro to Computer Science II
majors.special_requirements: Requires B or better in ICS 111 and ICS 211 to advance.

application_deadlines.notes: Recommended for scholarship and financial aid consideration.
Late applications may be accepted until June 2 on a space-available basis.

holistic_factors.specific_differentiators: Guaranteed admission for Hawaii residents with a 3.2+ cumulative GPA. Operates a 'Do No Harm' test-optional policy.

major_selection_tactics: Apply as 'Undeclared' or to a liberal arts major like Marketing to ensure general admission if your stats are borderline.
Utilize the High School Direct Entry (HSDE) route for Nursing if you have a 3.9+ GPA to bypass the 'competitive as hell' traditional pre-nursing route.
Check if you qualify for the Western Undergraduate Exchange (WUE) before selecting a major.
college_ranking_tactics: Select the College of Engineering to automatically waive the mandatory two-year Hawaiian/Second Language requirement.
Prioritize Shidler College of Business specifically for its nationally ranked International Business program if seeking mainland prestige.
Choose SOEST (School of Ocean and Earth Science and Technology) for high-tier research opportunities.
application_strategy.alternate_major_strategy: If rejected from Computer Science, apply to Creative Media (ACM) which offers technical tracks like Game Dev and VR, or Management Information Systems (MIS) in the Shidler College. For Nursing rejects, Kapi'olani Community College offers a high-quality RN program with a smoother internal transfer path to UHM later.

scholarships.name: Regents Scholarship
scholarships.amount: Full tuition, $4,000 annual stipend, and $2,000 travel grant
scholarships.benefits: Honors Program membership, personalized advising, priority registration

scholarships.name: Presidential Scholarship
scholarships.amount: Full tuition for 2 years, $4,000 annual stipend, and $2,000 travel grant
scholarships.benefits: Honors Program membership, priority registration, travel support

scholarships.name: Manoa Academic Merit Scholarship
scholarships.benefits: Renewable award for high-achieving incoming freshmen

scholarships.name: State of Hawaiʻi B Plus Scholarship
scholarships.benefits: Renewable for up to four years for public HS graduates

ap_policy.general_rule: Score of 3+ grants credit for most exams, including common electives.
exceptions: Calculus AB: Score of 3 yields no credit (only placement); 4-5 needed for credit
English Language/Literature: Score of 4-5 required for ENG 100 credit
AP Seminar: Score of 4-5 required for ENG 100 credit
ap_policy.usage: Can satisfy General Education (Foundations and Diversification) and major prerequisites

ib_policy.general_rule: Higher Level (HL) exams with scores of 5+ generally grant credit (some subjects like Economics accept 4)

what_it_takes: Minimum 3.2 cumulative GPA for guaranteed admission (Hawaii residents)
Mid-range GPA between 3.5 and 4.0 for competitive out-of-state applicants
Completion of specific core units: 4 English, 3 Math (including Algebra II), and 3 Science
essay_tips: Avoid the 'beach cliché'; connect the location to your specific academic goals
Highlight a 'Sense of Place' and how you will contribute to the diverse campus community
Be sincere—admissions values an authentic voice over a perfectly polished, generic one
red_flags: The 'Checkbox Fallacy'—having many shallow activities with no clear focus
Failing to disclose all previous post-secondary enrollment/credits
Missing the March 1st priority deadline for financial aid and scholarships
